name: La Citadelle de Hanoi Hotel

reviews.text: Myself and 4 other australian ladies stayed at the Sunshine 2 Hotel in September 2007, and were very impressed with all aspects of the Hotel and Staff. Its right in the thick of Old Hanoi and very clean, with the most accomodating staff you could ask for. Having very little knowledge of Vietnam, the staff made sure we were not overcharged for any extra tours, and even saved us money on some of them. A word to any traveller going to Vietnam, accept their customs, be very polite and laugh a lot, and dont let things like animals that are sometimes in restaurants and hotels be of a bother. Its all part of their way of life and is what makes this country so special.
reviews.title: This is the place to stay.
A Great Place to Stay!!
reviews.text: We came across quite a number of europeans who made us feel very ashamed of the way they treated the vietnamese, expecting everything to be the same as in their "first world" countries. Having said that, I once again reccomend the Sunshine 2 Hotel to any traveller.

reviews.title: nice clean rooms
reviews.text: I found the staff very helpful.The rooms were smart and well maintained.I stayed in the front rooms,408 on the first visit.Then visited Halong Bay for an overnight stay.On our return we were upgraded to room 508.Had a balcony and was a much bigger room,the fast internet connection in the room was a bonus.Another plus is that it's 5 min.walk to Hoam kiem Lake.Get a map though to find your way around the Old Quarter as every street tends to look the same.We got lost everytime we went out.I would highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Great hotel and location
reviews.text: For an economy hotel this is a great hotel in the Old Quarter. Clean and comfy. Book a back room if you want a quieter room and the deluxe rooms have a computer. Excellent location for walking around the Old Quarter. Breakfast is simple: eggs, fruit, bread, noodles and rice, but was enough to keep us going for the morning. They stored our extra luggage as we trekked through the Sapa area. Nice friendly staff.

reviews.title: Terrible - dingy rooms, cluttered corridors, security virtually absent
reviews.text: We booked a room at the Sunshine 2 hotel in October this year based on Tripadvisor reviews. Whilst there were no issues with our airport transfer, we were subsequently shown to a room which was much less than we expected. The bathroom was dark, with poor lighting, watermarks down the walls of the room itself, dirty linen on beds and virtually no security from the street, unlike other hotels in the vicinity which have manned front doors. Whilst the hotel also boasted in-room internet facilities, the connection itself was poor. We decided to move immediately to a nearby hotel which was cheaper, clean, well staffed, secure and excellently run. I would not recommend the Sunshine 2 hotel under any circumstances.

reviews.title: Ms. Moon a star!
reviews.text: Sunshine 2 Hotel is nothing flash but is clean, friendly and in one of the nicest (and quietest in terms of motorised traffic) streets in the Old Quarter.

reviews.title: Friendly Staff great Location
reviews.text: Whilst the breakfast could be served with a more cheery smile, Ms Moon more than compensates. Friendly, helpful and knowledgable, Ms Moon provided advice about tour options and other travel queries before efficiently booking internal flights and hotel pick-ups in other cities - all without commission.

reviews.title: Friendly, convenient, excellent
reviews.text: I had a delightul time in this hotel. The staff were like family, and stood in a line at on Ma May street as I left, waving and making their farewells.

reviews.title: A good stay @ Sunshine 2 Hotel
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable, the bedding, like new, the bathroom - luxurious, and a good internet link right there.

reviews.title: Great Location, helpful Staff
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is right next to the famous Handspan travel shot, the Big man beer restaurant, an ATM machine on the door, its own restaurant, motor cycle hire round the corner and the main route for everything else just one street away.

reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Time at Sunshine 2
reviews.text: I got help with all travel arrangements, destinations, securing the hire scooter, and attending to visitors. I slept past the breakfast deadline, yet they made me up a 'special' on the spot.

reviews.title: Miss this one - rude staff and terrible rooms!
reviews.text: Couldn't beat it for value and service..

reviews.title: Amazing location
reviews.text: Simply loved the location in the old quarters. Busy but cosy and convenient. We were there in the cool month. As long as the window is close, it's quiet in the room.

reviews.title: Luv Sunshine
reviews.text: We were given a family suite for 4 of us. The suite came with an internet access and attached webcam. We went away for Mount Sapa tour and Halong bay tour during our stay there. When we were back from the tours, we were given 2 separate rooms. We had no complaint for such arrangement. All the rooms we had were clean. The attached bathrooms were modern and the shower pressure was good.

reviews.title: Sweet Asians
reviews.text: We were particular happy with the Mt. Sapa tour and Halong Bay tour arraged by the agency service located at the hotel lobby. The lady who works with the agency was very professional. We were also very pleased with the service of the team of enthusiastic young men working there.

reviews.title: We usually leave so happy with our experience........
reviews.text: This is one nice budget hotel that we would like to recommend if you want to be right in the midst of bustling Hanoi.

reviews.title: Loved The Location
reviews.text: This is the second time my family (with 2 kids) stay in this hotel. We stay last year for a week. This time for 2 night with in between to Sapa (booked via sunshine). Rooms is clean, bed is comfortable. Location is excellent. Many restaurant nearby.

description: Welcome to La Citadelle De Hanoi hotel! This new 3 star hotel is centrally located in the heart of Old Quarter with 28 luxurious rooms and suites, 8 floors with elevator. Hotel is nearby everything you might need for your stay in Hanoi with local & Western restaurants, markets, souvenir shops, banks, tour agents ...And it takes you only 5 minutes walking to Hoankiem Lake, to Water Puppet theatre or Ngoc Son Temple and the night market at Hang Ngang – Hang Dao Str. All rooms are well & modern - designed for the most convenience and comfortable stay. Rooms have Air conditioner, PC connect to internet inside every room, free use of WIFI and cable internet are available throughout hotel, cable flat - TV, IDD phone, Hot & Cold shower, safety box. Our nice Vietnamese restaurant serving a variety of buffet breakfast with both local Vietnamese food, Hanoi typical food and also many Western Cuisine. Guest should try also our many kind of Rice Noodle soups and vermicelli noodles and a lot of kind of Vietnamese food made by our skilled chef and cook team.
